actions.text: Lift the lid off the teapot.
Pour hot water from the kettle into the teapot.
Retrieve the teapot lid from where it was set aside.
Open the tea bag box.
Select and remove a tea bag from the box.
Tear the tea bag wrapper.
Hold the tea bag by the string.
Steep the tea bag in the hot water.
Release the tea bag.
Place the lid back onto the teapot.
Pour the tea into the teacup from the kettle.
Hold the box or bottle of cream securely.
Unscrew the cap of the cream container.
Pour the cream into the teacup containing the steeped tea.
Reseal the cream container by screwing the cap back on.
Unfasten the lid of the sugar canister.
Grasp the spoon securely.
Scoop a spoonful of sugar with a teaspoon from the sugar canister.
Add the sugar into the teacup.
Stir the tea, cream, and sugar together with the teaspoon until well mixed.
Set the teaspoon down on the clean surface.
Fasten the lid of the sugar canister back on.
Pick up a pre-cut lemon half and a citrus reamer.
Extract the juice by pressing and twisting the reamer into the lemon over the teacup.
Put down the lemon and citrus reamer once sufficient juice is extracted.
Lift the teacup carefully by its handle.
Take a small, careful sip of the tea.
Repeat sipping the tea twice.
Lower the teacup back onto the saucer or table gently.
Pick up a piece of kitchen towel.
Wipe the teaspoon, teacup, and other used utensils with the kitchen towel.
Discard the used kitchen towel into the trash can.

scenes.scene_name: Making, Eating and Cleaning Instant Noodle

actions.text: Unseal the instant noodle container by tearing the lid halfway off.
Remove the veggie bag and oil packet from the container and put them on the table.
Pick up the veggie bag.
Tear open the veggie bag by pulling apart the wrapper.
Empty the veggie contents into the noodle container by shaking the bag.
Trash the empty veggie bag into the trash can.
Pinch the oil packet.
Tear open the oil packet by pulling apart the wrapper.
Squeeze the oil into the noodle container.
Dispose the empty oil packet into the trash can.
Pull the tissue upwards out of the tissue box.
Wipe the oil off your fingers with the tissue.
Throw away the used tissue into the trash can.
Pour hot water into the noodle container up to the fill line.
Reseal the container lid to trap the heat.
Hover your hand over the container to feel the temperature.
Wait for the noodles to cook for the recommended time.
Tear the lid off the noodle container.
Dispose the noodle container lid to the trash can.
Grab the fork
Submerge any floating noodles into the soup with the fork.
Untangle the noodles with the fork.
Stir the fork to further untangle the noodles.
Twirl the noodles on the fork.
Deliver the noodles to your mouth with the fork and eat.
Shake off any remaining noodles back into the bowl
Put the fork down on the table.
Grasp the disposable chopstick wrapper with one hand.
Tear open the wrapper by pulling apart the sealed edges.
Slide the chopsticks from the wrapper.
Hold the chopsticks together in one hand.
Split the chopsticks apart by gently pulling them in opposite directions.
Hold the chopsticks in one hand to prepare for eating noodles.
Lift the noodles with the chopsticks.
Split any entangled noodles with the chopsticks.
Dip the noodles back into the soup to absorb more flavor.
Deliver the noodles to your mouth with the chopsticks and eat.
Drop any remaining noodles on the chopsticks back into the container.
Put the chopsticks back on the table.
Hold the spoon.
Swirl the spoon in the noodle soup to cool it slightly.
Skim off excess oil from the soup with the spoon.
Dispose the skimmed oil to the trash can.
Spoon some noodle soup into the spoon.
Carry the soup to your mouth with the spoon and drink.
Put the spoon down on the table.
Hold the ramen container securely with two hands.
Tilt the container to sip the remaining soup directly.
Put the container back on the table.
Tear off a piece of kitchen towel.
Wipe the chopsticks with the kitchen towel.
Clean the spoon with the kitchen towel.
Dry the fork with the kitchen towel.
Discard the used kitchen towels into the trash can.
Empty the remaining contents of the container into the trash can.
Tie the trash bag closed.
Open the paper bag by separating the top flaps.
Take out all the food items and utensils from the bag.
Reposition the utensils in front of you.
Set up the food items in a reachable area.
Uncap the hand sanitizer bottle.
Apply a generous amount of sanitizer to your dominant hand.
Cap the hand sanitizer bottle.
Put the sanitizer bottle down on the table.
Rub your hands together to sanitize them thoroughly.
Hold the can of soda.
Pull the ring tab to open the soda can.
Insert a straw into the soda can.
Drink from the soda with the straw.
Put the soda can down.
Unwrap the burger and set the paper wrapper aside.
Deliver the burger to your mouth and take one or several bites.
Put the burger back on the plate.
Squeeze some ketchup out from the ketchup bottle onto the plate.
Grip a fry with your fingers.
Dip the fry into the ketchup.
Deliver the fry to your mouth and eat it.
Sprinkle any remaining salt on your fingers over the plate.
Peel off the lid of the dipping sauce container.
Grasp a piece of fried chicken thigh.
Dip the fried chicken thigh into the dipping sauce.
Rotate the chicken thigh as you eat it to get all sides.
Pick up one piece of napkin.
Unfold the napkin.
Wipe any crumbs or spills off the table with a napkin.
Scrunch the napkin into a ball.
Drop the napkin ball into the trash can.
Grasp the jar containing the pudding.
Pinch the rubber band around the pudding jar.
Stretch the rubber band and slide it off the jar.
Remove the cloth covering the jar to reveal the pudding.
Hold the pudding jar over a plate.
Invert the pudding jar to dump the pudding onto the plate.
Shake the jar to ensure all the pudding is transferred to the plate.
Scoop with a spoon to ensure all the puddings are transferred.
Put down the pudding jar.
Grip the pudding spoon.
Scoop a piece of pudding.
Deliver the pudding to your mouth and eat it.
Put down the pudding spoon.
Cover the remaining pudding with the pudding jar.
Flip the pudding jar and plate to transfer the remaining pudding back into the jar.
Lift the piece of cloth off the table.
Cover the pudding jar with the cloth.
Grip the rubber band.
Bind the pudding jar with the rubber band.
Put the pudding jar back on the table.
Gather the remaining chicken thigh and fries back into the food box.
Wrap the remaining burger with the paper wrapper.
Close the burger box.

activities.activity_name: Cleaning Up Drink and Food Items

actions.text: Pull out the straw from the soda can.
Wedge the used straw into the soda can opening.
Gather the remaining food items and place them back into the paper bag.
Fold the top of the paper bag to close it.
Clean your hands with hand sanitizer.

scenes.scene_name: Making an open egg and spam sandwich.

actions.text: Untwist the metal twist tie to unseal the bread bag.
Take out a slice of bread.
Twist the metal twist tie to reseal the bread bag.
Insert the bread slice into the toaster.
Tune the temperature of the toaster by rotating the knob to the highest degree.
Press the toaster lever to start toasting the bread.
Place the toasted bread on a plate.
Unscrew the lid of the peanut butter jar.
Take out a butter knife from the knife holder.
Insert the butter knife into the peanut butter jar.
Try to spread the peanut butter evenly on the toasted bread.
Wipe the jam spatula clean with a kitchen towel.
Insert the butter knife back into the knife holder.
Grasp the can of spam on the table.
Tear off the lid of the spam can to reveal the contents.
Lift the spam can above the cutting board.
Upturn the spam can to release the spam onto the cutting board.
Knock the bottom of the can to ensure the spam is fully released.
Grip a knife and fork.
Thrust the fork into the spam to stabilize it.
Slice the spam into even pieces.
Detach the fork from the last slice of spam.
Unwrap a piece of butter.
Grasp the butter knife.
Slice a piece of butter with the knife.
Place a pan on the stove.
Pretend to switch on the stove.
Adding the butter to the pan.
Spread the butter on the pan to melt it.
Put down the butter knife.
Take out a pair of tongs from the utensil holder.
Pick up a piece of spam using the tongs.
Transfer the spam to the pan with the tongs to fry.
Flip the spam with the tongs to ensure both sides are cooked.
Stack the fried spam on top of the bread.
Open the egg carton.
Take out an egg from the carton.
Move a bowl to be in front of you.
Crack the egg by tapping it against the edge of the bowl and split the shell.
Discard the eggshells into the trash can.
Close the egg carton.
Rotate the pepper grinder to add black pepper to the egg.
Shake the salt container to add salt to the egg.
Beat the egg in the bowl with a fork, blending the yolk and white thoroughly.
Pour the beaten egg into the heated pan.
Grasp a spatula.
Scramble the egg by moving the spatula around the pan.
Poke the egg with the spatula to test if it's cooked.
Stir-fry the egg.
Slide the cooked egg on top of the stacked bread and spam.
Put down the spatula.
Switch off the stove.
Turn the faucet on.
Thoroughly wash the lettuce leaves under the faucet.
Rinse the apple under running water.
Turn the faucet off.
Peel the lettuce leaves one by one, placing them into a bowl.
Soak the lettuce in a bowl of cold water.
Drain the lettuce leaves in a colander.
Gently shrink the lettuce leaves with your hands to wring out the water.
Tear the lettuce leaves into square pieces .
Unsheathe a fruit knife.
Shred the lettuce leaves into smaller pieces with the knife.
Tilt the chopping board to transfer the shredded lettuce to the salad bowl.
Strip a banana of its peel.
Lay the banana on the chopping board.
Slice the banana into three pieces.
Transfer the sliced banana into the salad bowl.
Peel the apple with a peeler.
Place the apple on the chopping board.
Pick up the knife.
Chop the apple into halves.
Cut the apple into smaller segments.
Dice the apple into smaller pieces.
Mince the apple pieces into small dice sizes.
Squash the apple dice with the flat side of the knife.
Scrape the squashed apple from the chopping board into the salad bowl.
Put down the knife.
Unzip the zipped bag with nuts
Take out nuts from the bag and place them on the chopping board.
Zip the bag closed.
Crush the nuts with the flat side of the knife.
Sweep the crushed nuts from the chopping board into the mortar.
Pick up the pestle.
Mash the nuts with a pestle.
Grind the mashed nuts into smaller chunks.
Pound the ground nuts into a fine consistency with the mortar pounder.
Put down the pestle.
Grate cheese with a cheese grater.
Pick two grapes from the bunk and drop them into the salad bowl.
In a large salad bowl, combine all the chopped ingredients. Use clean hands to toss the ingredients gently.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
Toss the salad in the bowl to coat all the ingredients thoroughly with the dressing.
Spear a variety of ingredients with a fork and bring them to your mouth to eat.
Scrape any leftover salad from the bowl into the trash can.
Clear the table by disposing of any remaining food.
Mop the table surface with a damp cloth or mop.
Dry your hands with a hand towel.
Stack the sieve on top of a bowl.
Pour the flour into the sieve.
Gently shake the sieve to sift the remaining flour.
Tap the edge of the sieve to allow the flour to fall evenly into the bowl.
Remove the sieve from the bowl.
Uncap a bottle of water.
Use a measuring cup to measure a cup of water.
Cap the water bottle.
Pour the water into the mixing bowl.
Scoop a ¼ spoonful of yeast.
Add the yeast to the mixing bowl.
Stir the ingredients with a spatula.
Beat the mixture with the spatula, using vigorous circular hand motions to fully incorporate air and blend the ingredients smoothly.
Pinch some extra flour from the flour bag.
Gently scatter the extra flour on the chopping board.
Move the dough to the floured chopping board.
Scrape down the sides of the mixing bowl with a dough scraper to gather the dough.
Knead the dough on the floured surface.
Push the dough with the heels of your hands into a flat shape.
Fold the dough over itself.
Repeat this push and fold motion 5 times.
Gently pat the dough to even out the surface and remove any air pockets.
Stretch and fold the dough to help develop structure and trap air bubbles.
Lift the stretched dough from one side.
Fold the lifted dough over to the opposite side.
Widen the dough by gently stretching it with both hands.
Divide the dough into two portions.
Shape the first portion into a roll.
Roll the dough into a pancake shape with a rolling pin.
Mold the pancake into a straw shape by rolling the pancake.
Crimp the ends of the straw to seal them and add texture.
Transfer the first portion to the baking tray.
Tuck the edges of the second portion to form smooth, tight shapes.
Score the surface of the dough with shallow cuts using a sharp knife.
Compress the second portion into the empty container.
Switch on the oven.
Open the oven door.
Stick a hand into the oven to check the temperature.
Transfer the baking tray into the oven.
Shut the oven door.
Open the oven door.
Wear oven mitts.
Pull out the baking tray from the oven.
Shut the oven door.
Tap the bottom of the loaf to check for doneness.
Waving your hands around the loaves for even cooling.
Grasp a knife for sawing.
Saw a small piece off the bread with the sawing knife.
Place the bread on a rotating cake stand.
Rotate the cake stand to ensure it moves smoothly.
Apply a layer of frosting on the top of the bread with the piping bag.
Hold a spatula for spreading frosting.
Spread frosting along the sides of the bread.
Turn the cake stand while spreading as needed for even coverage.
Smooth the frosting on the bread's surface with the spatula.
Put down the spatula.
Grip the piping bag.
Squeeze the piping bag to add circular decorations.
Squeeze the piping bag to add wave-like decorations.
Put down the piping bag.
Lift the blue book to sort through books on the desk.
Move the blue book and tuck it between the red book and black book.
Identify key topics in the books with your fingers.
Indicate the data mining book with your finger.
Open the blue book.
Turn pages of the books to the table of contents.
Search through the text in the books with your fingers.
Occasionally stop to focus on significant details or sections.
Open the red book to the table of contents.
Tear off a sticky note from the pad.
Stick the sticky note to the edge of the book as a bookmark.
Compare different sources to align the information between the blue and the red book.
Find the title of the second chapter of the blue book.
Use your index finger to guide your reading by tracking the section subtitles.
Track the flow of text with your finger to maintain focus.
Turn to page 200 of the book.
Close the book.
Flip to the back of the book to check the ISBN number.
Reopen the blue book to the bookmarked page.
Unzip the pencil case.
Take out a pencil from the pencil case.
Grip the pencil firmly for better control.
Circle the keyword of the first chapter.
Note the keyword of the second chapter.
Correct all the letters "o" in the chapter titles to "u".
Return the pencil to the pencil case.
Take out a marker pen from the pencil case.
Leave markers on the longest chapter title with the marker pen.
Write down the key topic of the book in one sentence.
Spin the pen in your hand.
Return the marker pen to the pencil case.
Take out a highlighter from the pencil case.
Uncap the highlighter.
Grip the highlighter firmly to prepare for writing.
Mark the keyword in the third chapter.
Point to the keyword in the fourth chapter with a pen.
Cap the highlighter.
Return the highlighter to the pencil case.
Take out an eraser from the pencil case.
Grip the eraser firmly for effective use.
Erase the marks left on the longest chapter.
Sweep away the eraser shavings with your hand.
Return the eraser to the pencil case.
Take out a correction tape from the pencil case.
Stick the correction tape over the keyword noted for the second chapter.
Return the correction tape to the pencil case.
Grip the notebook.
Flip the notebook to a clean page.
Adjust the angle or position of the notebook for comfortable writing.
Take out a color pen from the pencil case.
Uncap the color pen.
Grip the color pen to prepare for writing.
Draw star shapes at the top of the notebook.
Fill the star shapes using color pens.
Illustrate the key concepts in the book with a flow chart.
Display the mind map to others.
Cap the color pen.
Return the color pen to the pencil case.
Flip the notebook back to the cover page.
Close all three books.
Rearrange related books by putting them back in the bookstack.
Collect all remaining stationery back into the pencil case.
Zip up the pencil case.
Grip the string of the button envelope.
Unroll the string to open the button envelope.
Remove the files from the file folder by grasping them with your fingers and lifting them out.
Invert the file folder over a flat surface.
Shake the file folder to ensure all contents have fallen out.
Set aside the file folder.
Reorder all the contents into a pile, making sure the letter envelope is on top and the clasp envelope is on bottom
Slit the top edge of the envelope with a letter opener, ensuring not to damage the contents inside.
Extract the bound letter carefully to avoid tearing any pages.
Unfold the letter by reversing the folds with gentle hand movements.
Press down on the unfolded letter with both hands to flatten and remove any creases.
Lay the unfolded letter on a flat surface for reading.
Adjust the angles to straighten the paper for easy reading.
Read the letter by moving your eyes while your hands hold the edges to keep the paper steady.
Remove out the staple bind with the stapler remover.
Grasp the pen.
Uncap the pen.

activities.activity_name: Writing on and Stapling the Letter

actions.text: Write "Roses are red, Violets are blue" on one line.
Switch to another line and prepare for writing.
Write "That's what they say, But it just isn't true." on another line.
Cap the pen.
Place the pen on the table.
Realign letter papers to get ready for binding.
Staple the letter to secure documents together with the stapler.
Fold the letter into thirds, making precise folds to ensure a compact shape.
Put the letter into the envelope.
Grab the glue stick.
Uncap the glue stick.
Glue along the edge of the envelope.
Press the envelope to seal.
Cap the glue stick.
Put down the glue stick.
Stamp the corner of the envelope.

activities.activity_name: Handling the Clasp Envelope and Individual Pages

actions.text: Unclasp the metal clasp of the envelope by lifting and pulling it away from the slot.
Carefully pull out the file clipped at the top from the envelope.
Reverse the folds of the clipped document.
Read the document attentively, holding it with one hand and using the other to help navigate pages.
Unclip the clip from the top of the file by sliding it off.
Take out one page of the paper.
Crumple the taken-out page into a ball and set it aside.
Attach a paper clip to the top of the remaining aligned files to keep them together.
Fold the stacked files along the predetermined lines for compact storage.
Insert the folded files into a clasp envelope, aligning them within.
Clasp the metal clasp of the envelope.
Remove the clamped file from the envelope, grasping the edge opposite the clamp.
Flip the file to the third page.
Sign the third page using a smooth, flowing motion.
Open the side clamp by pressing the lever and gently pulling it away from the file.
Switch the signed page to the front page.
Arrange the signed files side by side, aligning them by their edges.
Secure the signed document within a clamp holder by pressing down on the clamp and sliding it into place.
Pile the clamped file, the clasp envelope and the letter envelope into a stack, with the letter envelope on bottom and the clasp envelope on top.
Insert the stacked content into the button envelope.
Rolling the string to close the button envelope.

Scan your fingerprint with the fingerprint scanner to unlock the laptop.
Type the password "Brown@1764" using the keyboard.

Press 'Fn' + 'F10' to brighten the screen.

Use the cursor to select all text in the document.

Press 'Ctrl + S' to save the document.
Click the 'X' to close the document.

Extend the selfie stick to its longest mode.
Tighten the selfie stick.
Rotate the selfie stick and GoPro to ensure the lens is facing yourself.
Loosen the selfie stick to prepare for shortening it.
Shorten the selfie stick.
Tighten the selfie stick.
Unscrew the screw from the selfie stick.
Detach the GoPro from the selfie stick.
Put the selfie stick back in the GoPro case.
Take out the tripod from the GoPro case.
Screw the tripod into the bottom of the GoPro.
Bend the tripod legs open.
Stabilize the tripod on the table.
Loosen the screw on the tripod.
Rotate the GoPro to have the lens facing yourself.
Tighten the tripod.
Adjust the GoPro to ensure it can film yourself.
Press the recording button to start filming.
Make a greeting gesture.
Snap once with your right hand.
Snap once with your left hand.
Snap once with both hands together.
Flick all of the fingers of your right hand as if you were flicking water (no actual water).
Flick once with your left hand in a similar motion.
Perform a salt sprinkling motion with your right hand (no actual salt).
Clap both hands together.
Give a thumbs-up gesture.
Interlock your fingers.
Cross your index and middle fingers on both hands.
Make a heart gesture with your hands.
Point to the camera.
Make expressive gestures with your hands to convey additional meaning or emotion.
Climbing like a monkey.
Press the recording button to stop filming.
Unscrew the tripod from the GoPro.
Straighten the tripod legs.
Put the tripod back in the GoPro case.
Pull down the notch of the GoPro side lid to change the battery.
Detach the battery from the battery slot.
Put the battery back in the GoPro case.
Close the battery lid.
Put the GoPro back in the GoPro case.
Unknot the ribbon by gently loosening the knot with your fingers.
Gently pull the ends of the ribbon to untie the bow.
Unwind the ribbon from around the gift.
Wind the ribbon into a neat coil for reuse.
Peel the tape off the wrapping paper by lifting one corner and pulling gently to avoid tearing the paper.
Unfold the wrapping paper by carefully spreading it out flat on a surface.
Set the box aside.
Gather the unfolded paper and roll it up for reuse.
Open the box by lifting the lid or flaps.
Remove the gift from the container, placing it gently on a table.
Upturn the box to access the bottom.
Unfold the box by pulling apart the flaps and flattening it out on the work surface.
Flatten the box by pressing it down firmly
Upturn the box to make the open side face up.
Fold along all of the pre-creased lines to shape the box.
Shape the box by aligning the sides and edges.
Interlock the flaps at the bottom to secure the structure.
Tuck the flaps into each other to secure the bottom.
Place the gift inside the assembled box, centering it for balance.
Close the lid securely.
Unroll the wrapping paper on a flat surface, pulling out enough to cover the box.
Measure the amount of wrapping paper needed with a ruler.
Use a pencil to draw cutting lines on the wrapping paper.
Fold the paper along the cutting lines to create a crease.
Tear the paper along the folded lines for a straight edge.
Trim the paper along the drawn lines with scissors for precise edges.
Fold the wrapping paper around the box, making neat and crisp edges.
Tear a piece of tape from the tape dispenser.
Tape the wrapping paper in place with pieces of tape.
Press the tape firmly to ensure it sticks.
Grasp a piece of paper and a pen to prepare for drawing.
Draw a heart shape on the paper using a pencil.
Cut out the heart shape with scissors, following the drawn lines carefully.
Uncap the glue stick.
Apply glue to the back of the heart cutout.
Cap the glue stick.
Attach the heart to the top of the wrapped box.
Press down on the heart to ensure it adheres.
Grasp a colored marker.
Use the colored marker to draw symmetrical patterns on one side of the box.
Repeat this on each side of the box, rotating the box after completing each side ensuring the patterns mirror each other on all sides.
Put down the colored marker
Pull the ribbon from the spool.
Measure the ribbon with a ruler.
Cut the ribbon to the measured length with scissors.
Wrap the ribbon around the box, bringing the ends to the top.
Tie the ribbon into a bow, adjusting the loops and tails for an even appearance.
Knot the ribbon to make a secure tie.
Turn on the lamp overhead to illuminate the work area.
Lay the stone block on the surface.
Sand the short side of the stone with sandpaper for 10 times to flatten the surface.
Fix the stone onto the carving bed using clamps.
Tighten the clamps securely to ensure the stone is held firmly.
Park your stone carving tools neatly beside the work area.
Align a ruler along the edge of the stone with your non-dominant hand to draw the margin lines.
Grasp a marker with your dominant hand.
Uncap the marker.
Draw a line along the ruler’s edge with a marker.
Rotate the stone 90 degrees to continue drawing lines along the other margins.
Align a ruler along the new edge of the stone to draw the margin lines.
Draw a line along the ruler’s edge with a marker.
Cap the marker.
Put down the marker.
Grasp the chisel.
Aim at the intersection of the margin lines with the chisel.
Strike the chisel at the intersection of the margin lines to knock off a small piece of the stone.
Carve along one of the margin lines with the thinner side of the chisel.
Shave the margin of the stone with the wider side of the chisel.
Brush off the stone dust using a brush.
Put down the chisel.
Polish the surface of the stone with the sandpaper.
Lightly loosen the clamps.
Release the stone from the carving bed.
Uncover the lid of the stamp pad.
Grasp the stone.
Press the stone into the stamp pad.
Stamp the stone on the stamp paper.
Put down the stone.
Cover the stamp pad with the lid.
Sharpen the chisel with the sharpening stone.
Shut off the lamp to complete the process.

scenes.scene_name: Assemble and Disassemble Kids Tool Bench

actions.text: Position the wood over the clamp.
Tighten the clamp by turning the screw handle until the wood pieces are securely held.
(Pretending) Saw back and forth along the cutting line, applying even pressure to make a straight cut.
Position the nail at any hole.
Hammer the nail into the hole using the hammer.
Position another screw at the desired spot on the wood.
Select the appropriate screwdriver for the screw type.
Grasp the handle of the screwdriver with your dominant hand.
Turn the screwdriver clockwise to drive the screw into the hole.
Run your hands over the workbench to inspect any defects.
Hang the wrench on the hook.
Position the screw at the desired spot on the wood.
Grip the drill handle firmly.
Pull the drill trigger to start the drill.
Drill the screw into the hole.
Detach the drill bit from the drill.
Put down the drill.
Grab the pliers to prepare for gripping the nail.
Open the pliers by pushing the handles apart.
Grip the nail with the jaws of the pliers.
Pull out the nail with the pliers.
Put down the pliers.
Unhook the monkey wrench from the hook.
Adjust the jaws of the monkey wrench to fit the size of the bolt.
Grasp the handle of the monkey wrench.
Turn the adjustable knob to tighten the jaws.
Tighten the bolts with the monkey wrench.
Hook the monkey wrench back on the hook.
Unmount the wrench from the hook.
Position the wrench on the bolt.
Turn the wrench to unfasten the bolts.
Reposition the wrench on the screw.
Turn the wrench to unfasten the screw.
Mount the wrench back on the hook.
Grasp the skate tool to prepare for unscrewing.
Position the skate tool on top of the other screw.
Unscrew the other screw from the hole.
Put down the skate tool.
Attach the snap buttons at the four corners of the replanting mat.
Unpack the bag of soil from its packaging to get ready for filling the pot.
Grasp the shovel.
Scoop soil from the bag and hold it in the shovel.
Transfer the soil to the pot.
Break apart any large clumps in the soil.
Fill the pot halfway with potting soil.
Put down the shovel.
Insert the transplant tool into the soil to prepare a hole for transplanting.
Remove the transplant tool.
Ease the plant out of its nursery container, supporting the root ball.
Place the plant in the soil-filled pot.
Scoop additional soil around the plant in the pot.
Fill the whole pot by repeatedly scooping the soil.
Hold the base of the plant to keep it steady.
Press the soil down to eliminate air pockets.
Penetrate the soil with your fingers to create a loose layer.
Aerating the soil with the rake.
Squeeze the watering bottle to water the plant.
Scatter mulch over the soil to retain moisture.
Distribute the mulch with your hands to even it out.
Straighten the plant to ensure it is upright.
Pump the air dust blower to blow away dust on leaves.
Spray the foliage of the plant evenly with the spray bottle.
Dig around the plant to loosen the soil with the rake.
Ease the plant out by gently pulling on the base.
Uproot the plant carefully to avoid damaging the roots.
Shake the plant gently to remove excess soil.
Store the plant properly in the nursery container.
Pick up the pot.
Empty all remaining soil from the pot to the zip bag.
Tap the bottom of the pot to release soil.
Tip the pot over to continue removing remains.
Put down the pot.

scenes.scene_name: Sewing kit, Crocheting, Knitting and Finger Knitting

actions.text: Organize the content inside the sewing kit for easy access.
Grasp the scissors for cutting.
Cut the eyes, mouth and other parts aligning the cutting line.
Stick the eyes and other parts on the face of the planet.
Unwrap the thread the spool.
Gently untangle any knot thread using both hands.
Tie the thread to the needle.
Sew the fabric pieces together with the needle through the holes while leaving a little space for stuffing.
Fill the planet with cotton.
Stitch the little space together.
Knot the end of the thread to secure the cottons.
Untie the thread from the needle.
Puncture the used needle into the futon.
Cut the excess thread with the scissors.
Pick up the yarn and the crochet hook.
Make a slip knot by forming a loop with the yarn. Insert the crochet hook into the loop. Pull the working yarn through the loop.
Yarn over by wrapping the yarn around the hook from back to front.
Pull the yarn through the loop on the hook to create a chain stitch.
Repeat the yarn over and pull through steps to create 10 chain stitches for the foundation.
Crochet a single row.
Cut the yarn, leaving a tail.
Weave in ends of yarn or thread using the hook.
Pick up the yarn and the knitting needles.
Make a slip knot by forming a loop with the yarn. Insert the crochet hook into the loop. Pull the working yarn through the loop.

Cast on by looping the yarn around your thumb and forefinger of your left hand. Insert the needle under the yarn loop on your thumb. Pull the yarn through the loop on your thumb to form a new stitch. Place the new stitch onto the needle, sliding it to the end.

Hold the knitting needles in each hand. Use the left needle to hold the stitches, and the right needle to insert into a stitch, wrap the yarn around it, and pull through to create a new stitch, transferring it to the right needle.
Cut the yarn, leaving a tail.
Weave in ends of yarn or thread using a needle or hook. Thread the loose end through the eye of a needle or hook, and weave it through the completed stitches to secure and hide the end.
Pick up a thick yarn for finger knitting.
Create a slip knot by forming a loop with the yarn. Insert your index finger and thumb into the loop. Pull the working yarn through the loop to tighten the knot around your finger.
Cast on by looping the yarn around your index and middle fingers, then over the ring and pinky fingers, forming a figure-eight pattern.

Knit by lifting the bottom loop over the top loop on each finger, starting with the pinky and moving to the index finger. Repeat lifting the bottom loop over the top loop on each finger until only one loop remains on each finger.
Cut the yarn, leaving a tail.
Pull the yarn tail through the last loop to secure the end.
Pull the knitted yarn off your hand.
Thread the yarn tail onto a yarn needle or use your fingers to weave in the ends.

scenes.scene_name: Playing monopoly, cards, coins and knucklebones.

actions.text: Unfold the game board.
Grab the deck from the game box.
Split the deck into chance, community chest, and property cards.
Shuffle the chance and community chest decks separately.
Place the chance and community chest decks on their designated spaces on the board.
Grasp the player piece and place it on the GO space.
Grab one pile of dollars from the game box.
Distribute one of each dollar type to yourself.
Place the game piece at the starting point.
Fetch the dice from the box.
Shake the dice in your hand.
Roll the dice.
Move your game piece according to the dice roll.
Pay $100 to the bank.
Take a light-blue property card.
Pretending to pass the dice to the next player.
Grab the dice.
Draw a chance card.
Display the card to other players.
Withdraw $50 from the bank.
Pay $50 to the bank.
Place a house and hotel on two properties.
Count your money.
Remove your player piece from the board.
Combine the chance, community chest, and property card decks.
Return your money to the bank.
Place the dice back in the box.
Flip the game board for playing other props.
Grab the deck of cards from the game box.
Hold the deck with one hand.
Split the deck into two halves, with one half in each hand.
Grip the deck on the short sides with your thumb and middle finger.
Do the bridge shuffle, allowing the cards to arc and fall into place.
Shuffle in another interesting way.
Straighten the cards in one hand so that they are even.
Perform a two-hand cut, taking the upper half of the deck and placing it face-down underneath the bottom half.
Fan out the cards facing yourself to create a broad display that is easy to view.
Choose and grab a card from the fan.
Compose the cards back into a single deck, keeping the chosen card separate.
Place the card on top of the deck.
Deal three piles of three cards.
Place the deck on the table.
Swap the locations of two piles.
Alter back the location of two piles.
Slide one pile directly in front of you.
Pick up and look at one card from that pile before returning it.
Lift a portion of the main deck slightly off the table.
Flip the portion of the cards so that they are face-up.
Fan the face-up cards.
Sort the cards by taking two cards from the right side of the fan and placing it on the left side.
Draw a card from the main deck to add to your hand.
Play a card by placing it face-up next to the main deck.
Reassemble the cards into a single deck.
Stack one three-card pile on top of another.
Flip over the face-up deck.
Scramble the cards on the table while keeping them face-down.
Put the cards back in the game box.
Grip a fake coin out of the game box.
Spin the coin.
Toss the coin into the air and let it fall.
Toss the coin into the air and catch it.

Flip a coin using your right thumb, catch it in the palm of your right hand, flip your right hand onto the back of your left hand, and remove your right hand to reveal the coin on the back of your left hand.
Play a round of knucklebones with three coins.
Collect the coins and put them in the game box.
Fold up the game board.
Close the game board.
Grasp the flute with both hands, placing your left hand closer to the mouthpiece and your right hand near the end.
Position your fingers over the holes or keys as a starting pose.
Press down on the holes or keys with your fingers to change the notes.
Release the holes or keys to return to the open note.
Slide your fingers to different positions to play different notes.
Trill by rapidly alternating between two adjacent notes by quickly pressing and releasing the holes.
Gradually speed up the alternation of the notes.
Gradually slow down the alternation of the notes.
Try to play a piece of music.
Put down the flute.
Grip the drumsticks firmly with both hands.
Balance the drumsticks in your hands, ensuring they are comfortable to hold.
Poke the drum with a drumstick to test the elasticity of the drumhead.
Raise the drumsticks above the drumhead.
Strike the drumhead with one drumstick, then the other, in a rhythmic pattern.
Tap the drumhead lightly for softer sounds.
Pound the drumhead harder for louder sounds.
Roll the drumsticks across the drumhead for a continuous sound.
Rapidly alternate strikes between the two drumsticks to create a trill effect.
Gradually speed up the alternation.
Gradually slow down the alternation.
Crescendo by gradually increasing the volume of the strikes.
Decrescendo by gradually decreasing the volume of the strikes.
Play a piece of music.
Put down the drumsticks.
Tap the drumhead lightly with your fingertips for softer sounds.
Pound the drumhead with the palms of your hands for louder sounds.
Alternate between tapping and pounding to create different rhythms.
Grasp the body of the ukulele.
Support the neck of the ukulele with your left hand.
Place your left-hand fingers on the fretboard to form chords.
Press down on the strings with your fingertips to produce clear notes.
Strum the strings with your right hand, using your thumb or a pick.
Brush your fingers lightly across the strings for a softer sound.
Pluck individual strings with your thumb and fingers.
Rapidly alternate between two adjacent notes to create a trill effect.
Gradually speed up the alternation.
Gradually slow down the alternation.
Crescendo by gradually increasing the volume of the notes.
Decrescendo by gradually decreasing the volume of the notes.
Change chords by lifting your fingers off the fretboard and sliding your fingers to new positions to form different chords.
Press down on the strings again to play the new chords.
Play a piece of music.
Put down the ukulele.
Grasp the Otamatone's stem firmly with your non-dominant hand.
Support the base of the Otamatone with your dominant hand, keeping it steady.
Slide your finger along the stem while squeezing the face of the otamatone.
Press down on the stem to ensure the note is clear and precise.
Squeeze the cheeks of the Otamatone's face to control the volume.
Wobble your finger back and forth on the stem while holding a note.
Gradually speed up the wobbling.
Gradually slow down the wobbling.
Play a piece of music.
Put down the Otamatone.
Place your hands on the keyboard, with your fingers resting lightly on the keys.
Space your fingers by spreading them comfortably across the keys.
Press down on and hold the keys with your fingertips to play notes.
Release the keys to stop the notes.
Slide your fingers to adjacent keys to play different notes.
Position your fingers over multiple keys to form chords.
Press down on the keys simultaneously to play the chords.
Coordinate your left and right hands to play a piece of music.
Alternate between your left and right hands to create a dynamic sound.
Turn the volume knob to adjust the overall volume.
Play a piece of music.
Rapidly alternate between two adjacent keys to create a trill effect.
Gradually speed up the alternation.
Gradually slow down the alternation.
Crescendo by gradually increasing the volume of the notes.
Decrescendo by gradually decreasing the volume of the notes.
Grasp the triangle with one hand by holding the holder at the top.
Suspend the triangle in the air to allow it to resonate freely.
Tap the triangle with the striker, hitting the inside of the triangle to produce a clear tone.
Roll the striker around the edges of the triangle to create a continuous ringing sound.
Put down the triangle.
Position the harp on the surface, ensuring it is stable.
Grasp the harp with both hands, placing your fingers on the strings.
Pluck the strings with your fingertips to produce notes. Use your thumb, index, middle, and ring fingers to pluck different strings.
Slide your fingers to different strings to change notes.
Pluck the strings simultaneously to play the chords.
Pluck the strings with varying pressure to control the volume. Pluck harder for louder notes and softer for quieter notes.
Gradually speed up your plucking.
Gradually slow down your plucking.
Crescendo by gradually increasing the volume of your plucking.
Decrescendo by gradually decreasing the volume of your plucking.
Lay the harp on the flat surface, now using it as a zither.
Pluck the strings with your fingertips to produce notes. Use your thumb, index, middle, and ring fingers to pluck different strings.
Slide your fingers to different strings to change notes.
Pluck the strings simultaneously to play the chords.
Strum the strings with your fingers or a pick to produce a continuous sound.
Brush your fingers lightly across the strings for a softer sound.
Touch the strings lightly.
Pluck the strings while maintaining the light touch with the left hand to produce harmonic sounds.
Gradually speed up your plucking.
Gradually slow down your plucking.
Crescendo by gradually increasing the volume of your plucking.
Decrescendo by gradually decreasing the volume of your plucking.
Grasp the pump nozzle with one hand and the boxing bag with the other.
Insert the pump nozzle into the air valve of the boxing bag.
Pump air into the boxing bag by pressing down on the pump handle repeatedly.
Squeeze the bag with your hand to check for firmness.
Inflate the boxing bag until it reaches the desired firmness.
Remove the pump nozzle from the air valve once the bag is fully inflated.
Align the stand with the base, ensuring the holes for connectors are properly positioned.
Insert the stand into the aligned holes.
Tighten the stand until it is securely attached to the base.
Attach the inflated boxing bag to the top of the stand by sliding it onto the rod.
Wrap boxing hand wraps on both hands to protect your hands.
Position your hands to get ready for boxing.
Clench your fists, keeping your thumbs outside your fingers.
Jab the boxing bag with your dominant hand, using a quick, snapping motion.
Follow with a cross punch using your non-dominant hand, rotating your body slightly for added power.
Deliver a hook punch by swinging your dominant hand in a horizontal arc.
Perform an uppercut by driving your fist upward from a low position.
Combine punches in sequences, such as jab-cross-hook-uppercut.
Punch the bag with controlled force for one strike.
Aim your punches at specific targets on the boxing bag to improve accuracy.
Shoot quick, sharp punches at the bag in rapid succession to practice speed and precision.
Slap the sides of the bag with an open hand to vary your training technique.
Block by raising your arms to shield your face and body from imaginary punches.
Dodge by leaning or stepping to the side to avoid imaginary attacks.
Feint by making a quick, deceptive movement to trick an imaginary opponent.
Take off the boxing wraps from both hands.
Separate the boxing bag from the stand.
Press the bag to expel air, starting from the top and working your way down.
Continue pressing and rolling the bag until all the air is removed.
Roll the bag tightly to remove any remaining air.
Unscrew the stand from the base using a wrench or screwdriver.
Separate the stand from the base by pulling them apart.
Feed the puppy with treats.
Pet the puppy on the head.
Gently stroke the puppy's head and back.
Pat the puppy gently on the sides, using a soft, rhythmic patting motion with the palm of your hand to make the puppy feel loved and secure.
Scratch behind the ears and under the chin.
Tickle the puppy gently on its belly.
Toss a toy gently near the puppy.
Clap your hands softly to praise the puppy as it brings the item back, encouraging it to chase and retrieve.
Throw another toy for the puppy to chase.
Point towards the thrown object to guide the puppy.
Grip one end of a tug toy firmly.
Tug the toy gently, engaging the puppy in a playful tug-of-war.
Pull the toy back and forth with gentle resistance.
Swing a snack-shaped toy enticingly to catch the puppy's attention.
Hold the comb in one hand and gently run it through the puppy’s fur.
Untangle any knots in the puppy's fur using the comb.
Brush the fur gently with smooth, even strokes.
Pluck any loose fur or debris from the puppy's coat as you comb.
Shave the hair around the puppy's paws carefully.
Shear the underbelly hair of the puppy gently to keep it neat.
Wet the puppy's fur thoroughly with water.
Apply dog shampoo and create a lather.
Scrub the fur gently to clean it.
Rinse off the shampoo thoroughly with water.
Dry the puppy with a towel, gently patting and rubbing to remove excess moisture.
Pin a hairpin in the puppy's fur for a cute accessory.
Unbuckle the collar gently.
Position the collar around the puppy's neck.
Buckle the collar securely.
Adjust the fit of the collar for comfort.
Hold the clothes with both hands.
Lift the puppy's front paws and guide them through the armholes of the clothes.
Pull the clothes up over the puppy's body.
Adjust the fit of the clothes to ensure comfort.
Fasten the Velcro straps to secure the clothes in place.
Hold the paw gently.
Trim the nails carefully with nail clippers.
Dab ear cleaning solution onto a cotton ball.
Clean the outer ears gently with the cotton ball.
Apply dog toothpaste to a toothbrush.
Brush the puppy's teeth gently, ensuring you cover all areas.
